items.title: JPMorgan Chase tops quarterly expectations as Dimon says U.S. economy faces ‘considerable turbulence’
items.content: While JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon touted his company's solid results in the quarter, he also struck a note of caution on the broader economy.
items.contentSnippet: While JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon touted his company's solid results in the quarter, he also struck a note of caution on the broader economy.

items.title: Morgan Stanley tops quarterly estimates on stronger-than-expected stock trading
items.content: Shares of Morgan Stanley, like those of its peers, have whipsawed in recent days amid President Donald Trump's trade policies.
items.contentSnippet: Shares of Morgan Stanley, like those of its peers, have whipsawed in recent days amid President Donald Trump's trade policies.

items.title: MLB could draw greater private equity interest as uncertainties lie ahead
items.content: MLB teams have been slowly attracting private equity investors as the league braces for potential changes to player salaries and media rights deals.
items.contentSnippet: MLB teams have been slowly attracting private equity investors as the league braces for potential changes to player salaries and media rights deals.

items.title: The wealthy are loading up on cash, gold and family trusts during market turmoil
items.content: Several top executives in wealth management said that unlike the crashes in 2020 or 2008, high-net-worth investors were feeling less pressure to sell.
items.contentSnippet: Several top executives in wealth management said that unlike the crashes in 2020 or 2008, high-net-worth investors were feeling less pressure to sell.

items.title: Trump’s pivot on tariffs shows that Wall Street still has a seat at his table
items.content: This past week shows that financial markets, and by proxy Wall Street statesmen like Jamie Dimon, are still guardrails on the Trump administration.
items.contentSnippet: This past week shows that financial markets, and by proxy Wall Street statesmen like Jamie Dimon, are still guardrails on the Trump administration.

items.title: State Farm pleads for emergency rate hikes on California homeowners
items.content: State Farm argues it needs additional funds to boost capital and avert an increasingly dire financial situation following the devastating Los Angeles wildfires.
items.contentSnippet: State Farm argues it needs additional funds to boost capital and avert an increasingly dire financial situation following the devastating Los Angeles wildfires.

items.title: Trump's immigration policy is weighing on beer sales, Constellation Brands CEO says
items.content: Roughly half of Constellation's beer sales come from Hispanic consumers.
items.contentSnippet: Roughly half of Constellation's beer sales come from Hispanic consumers.

items.title: MLB weighs a salary cap as potential lockout looms in 2026
items.content: MLB executives at both the league and team level have discussed what a new league economic structure could look like as the CBA expires 2026.
items.contentSnippet: MLB executives at both the league and team level have discussed what a new league economic structure could look like as the CBA expires 2026.

items.title: Delta CEO says Trump tariffs are hurting bookings as airline pulls 2025 forecast
items.content: Delta said it couldn't reaffirm its 2025 financial guidance.
items.contentSnippet: Delta said it couldn't reaffirm its 2025 financial guidance.

items.title: Walmart says Trump tariffs could hit quarterly profits as it tries to keep prices low
items.content: Walmart said it wants to maintain the ability to keep prices low, which could affect its profits.
items.contentSnippet: Walmart said it wants to maintain the ability to keep prices low, which could affect its profits.

items.title: Here's how China could crush the U.S. housing market
items.content: China is one of largest owners of U.S. mortgages. There is growing concern that in retaliation for tariffs the country could sell them, causing rates to rise.
items.contentSnippet: China is one of largest owners of U.S. mortgages. There is growing concern that in retaliation for tariffs the country could sell them, causing rates to rise.

items.title: Pharmaceutical stocks rise as Trump pauses tariffs but not for China
items.content: Trump on Tuesday said his administration will be announcing a "major" tariff on pharmaceuticals "very shortly."
items.contentSnippet: Trump on Tuesday said his administration will be announcing a "major" tariff on pharmaceuticals "very shortly."

items.title: Canada's 25% auto tariffs are in effect. Here's how they differ from the U.S.
items.content: Canada's 25% auto tariffs took effect Wednesday, but the new levies differ in many ways from those implemented last week by President Donald Trump.
items.contentSnippet: Canada's 25% auto tariffs took effect Wednesday, but the new levies differ in many ways from those implemented last week by President Donald Trump.

items.title: As warehouse clubs boom, Walmart-owned Sam's Club plans to open 15 stores per year
items.content: The warehouse club is speeding up its expansion plans, even as tariffs rattle Wall Street and injected fresh uncertainty about the economic outlook.
items.contentSnippet: The warehouse club is speeding up its expansion plans, even as tariffs rattle Wall Street and injected fresh uncertainty about the economic outlook.

items.title: FDA guts division that trains staff and health-care professionals on key practices like opioid safety, avoiding drug errors
items.content: The FDA is losing a central resource for employees to go to for key training and professional development
items.contentSnippet: The FDA is losing a central resource for employees to go to for key training and professional development

items.title: Fake job seekers are flooding U.S. companies that are hiring for remote positions, tech CEOs say
items.content: Companies have long faced external attacks from hackers. Now, thanks to generative AI, another threat has emerged: Employees who aren't who they say they are.
items.contentSnippet: Companies have long faced external attacks from hackers. Now, thanks to generative AI, another threat has emerged: Employees who aren't who they say they are.

items.title: Walmart is facing tariffs and recession fears. It may have a secret weapon to keep growing
items.content: Walmart said its Walmart+ members account for about half its e-commerce sales, a key source of revenue as tariffs raise worries about the economy.
items.contentSnippet: Walmart said its Walmart+ members account for about half its e-commerce sales, a key source of revenue as tariffs raise worries about the economy.

items.title: Mortgage rates slingshot higher as tariff uncertainty roils markets
items.content: After falling sharply last week, mortgage rates rose again this week, wiping out any advantage to the spring housing market. Tariffs were behind the volatility.
items.contentSnippet: After falling sharply last week, mortgage rates rose again this week, wiping out any advantage to the spring housing market. Tariffs were behind the volatility.

items.title: GM axing Cadillac XT6 crossover, extending production of another vehicle in Tennessee
items.content: GM is ending production this year of a gas-powered Cadillac crossover at a plant in Tennessee, while extending production of another vehicle at the facility.
items.contentSnippet: GM is ending production this year of a gas-powered Cadillac crossover at a plant in Tennessee, while extending production of another vehicle at the facility.

items.title: U.S. financial regulator says email hack exposed sensitive data on banks
items.content: The breach, first disclosed and resolved in February, involved information related to the "financial condition of federally regulated financial institutions…"
items.contentSnippet: The breach, first disclosed and resolved in February, involved information related to the "financial condition of federally regulated financial institutions…"

items.title: Walgreens tops estimates as drugstore chain cuts costs, prepares to go private
items.content: The company is in the process of being taken private by Sycamore Partners in a deal that is expected to close in the fourth quarter of this year.
items.contentSnippet: The company is in the process of being taken private by Sycamore Partners in a deal that is expected to close in the fourth quarter of this year.

items.title: 'Minecraft' box-office jolt offers hope for the summer slate
items.content: "A Minecraft Movie" sets record for highest opening of a video game adaptation, giving much needed jolt to the domestic box office ahead of the summer slate.
items.contentSnippet: "A Minecraft Movie" sets record for highest opening of a video game adaptation, giving much needed jolt to the domestic box office ahead of the summer slate.

items.title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon says Trump tariffs will boost inflation, slow an already weakening U.S. economy
items.content: Jamie Dimon is the first Wall Street CEO to publicly address President Trump's sweeping tariff policy as global markets tumble.
items.contentSnippet: Jamie Dimon is the first Wall Street CEO to publicly address President Trump's sweeping tariff policy as global markets tumble.

items.title: Auto sales are on a 'roller coaster ride' as tariffs are expected to increase prices
items.content: Trump's 25% tariffs on imported vehicles and upcoming 25% levies on auto parts are expected to add thousands of dollars to the costs of new cars and trucks.
items.contentSnippet: Trump's 25% tariffs on imported vehicles and upcoming 25% levies on auto parts are expected to add thousands of dollars to the costs of new cars and trucks.

items.title: Restaurant stocks fall as investors fear recession, sales slowdown
items.content: Restaurant stocks, from McDonald's to Chipotle, fell as investors fear a recession is coming.
items.contentSnippet: Restaurant stocks, from McDonald's to Chipotle, fell as investors fear a recession is coming.

items.title: Airlines expected to cut 2025 outlooks as travel demand falters
items.content: Wall Street analysts have slashed their price targets for U.S. airlines and downgraded ratings as concerns about travel demand grow.
items.contentSnippet: Wall Street analysts have slashed their price targets for U.S. airlines and downgraded ratings as concerns about travel demand grow.

items.title: Spirit Airlines CEO Ted Christie steps down
items.content: Ted Christie, CEO of Spirit Airlines, is stepping down from his role leading the embattled carrier, which just emerged from bankruptcy protection.
items.contentSnippet: Ted Christie, CEO of Spirit Airlines, is stepping down from his role leading the embattled carrier, which just emerged from bankruptcy protection.

items.title: GM reveals Corvette EV concept car as it reconfirms commitment to Europe
items.content: General Motors on Monday revealed a new all-electric Chevrolet Corvette concept car as part of the opening of a new design studio in England.
items.contentSnippet: General Motors on Monday revealed a new all-electric Chevrolet Corvette concept car as part of the opening of a new design studio in England.

items.title: Automakers seek ‘opportunity in the chaos’ of Trump’s tariffs
items.content: Ford and Stellantis are offering employee-pricing programs, while Hyundai said it would not raise prices for at least two months to ease consumer concerns.
items.contentSnippet: Ford and Stellantis are offering employee-pricing programs, while Hyundai said it would not raise prices for at least two months to ease consumer concerns.

items.title: Medicare, Medicaid agency cuts jobs from minority health office, other divisions, as RFK Jr. guts U.S. health department
items.content: CMS detailed some of the specific offices impacted by cuts under Kennedy's broader plan to restructure the Department of Health and Human Services.
items.contentSnippet: CMS detailed some of the specific offices impacted by cuts under Kennedy's broader plan to restructure the Department of Health and Human Services.
